body.p:
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioners would very respectfully represent that at the February Term 1861 of the Daviess Circuit Court, a Judgment was rendered against Wm J Johnson for Two hundred dollars & costs of prosecution, for permitting unlawful Gaming in his house. The proof was that, Johnson was a hotel keeper in Boston Daviess County, and had once or twice allowed a game of Euchre to be played for drinks, that he had never allowed a game to be played for money in his house. Under the law the jury reluctantly rendered a verdict against the Deft for the lowest amount $200. and the Jurors afsd. now unanimously, ask your Excellency to remit Said fine. They think the legal costs a heavy penalty for the affence. Mr. Johnson is a civil and well behaved man, is poor, and has for a long time been weakly and in delicate health, & has a large family dependant upon him for a Support, and they will ever pray &c
